ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: spell problems
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t keep a hotkey for senseheading up though.I have my hotkeys filled with other stuff. And I have different hotkeys set in different places for my various
ygData.messageBody:
I don't keep a hotkey for senseheading up though.I have my hotkeys filled
with other stuff. And I have different hotkeys set in different places for
my various characters.
luv,
-Su


> What my son and I did was to map the hot key to the right turn
> button. Every time we turn right, we sense heading. Builds skill
> quickly. Can be done for foraging, as well, but you end up with stuff
> on your cursor as you run around. Not always a good thing.
>
> Barto
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
> > How could you add a skill like senseheading? is there a typed
> command you
> > can use for senseheading?
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
> > >
> > > that would work or you could use a social button and use
> the /Cast (number
> > of spell slot)
> > >
> > > i.e /cast 1 to cast the spell in the first slot
> > >
> > > that way u can add in things like warnings or other skills like
> sense
> > heading :)
> > >
> > >
> > > >From: "Su"
> > > >Reply-To: EverQuest@y...
> > > >To:
> > > >Subject: Re: [EverQuest] spell problems
> > > >Date: Mon, 2 Sep 2002 16:29:32 -0500
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >Do you first put them in the book, and then put them in the
> spell mem
> > slots?
> > > >Then you can hold the left mouse cursor down over them and place
> them in
> > the
> > > >hotkeys.
> > > >luv,
> > > >-Su
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > > i'm a new member to everquest i hope you can help me. i can't
> figure
> > > > > out how to get the spells onto the hotkeys.
> > > > >
